Virginia, 518 U.S. 515, 533 (1996); 4 (2) "inherent differences" range chromosomal hormonal differences physiological differences; 6 (3) Men generally "denser, stronger bones, tendons, ligaments" "larger hearts, greater lung volume per body mass, higher red blood cell count, higher hemoglobin," Neel 8 Burton, Battle Sexes, Psychology Today (July 2, 2012); 9 (4) Men also higher natural levels testosterone, affects traits hemoglobin levels, body fat content, storage use carbohydrates, development type 2 muscle fibers, result men able generate higher speed power physical activity, Doriane Lambelet Coleman, Sex Sport, Law Contemporary 13 Problems 63, 74 (2017) (quoting Gina Kolata, Men, Women Speed. 2 Words: Got 14 Testosterone?, N.Y. Times (Aug. 21, 2008)); 15 (5) biological differences females males, especially relates natural levels testosterone, "explain male female secondary sex characteristics develop puberty lifelong effects, including important success sport: categorically different strength, speed, endurance," Doriane Lambelet Coleman Wickliffe 19 LC001518 - Page 2 5 Shreve, "Comparing Athletic Performances: Best Elite Women Boys Men," Duke Law 1 Center Sports Law Policy; 2 (6) classifications based sex generally disfavored, Supreme Court recognized "sex classifications may used compensate women particular economic disabilities [they have] suffered, promote equal employment opportunity, [and] advance full development talent capacities Nation's people," United States v. Virginia, 518 6 U.S. 515, 533 (1996); 7 (7) One place sex classifications allow "full development talent capacities Nation's people" context sports athletics; 9 (8) Courts recognized inherent, physiological differences males females result different athletic capabilities. See e.g. Kleczek v. Rhode Island Interscholastic 11 League, Inc., 612 A.2d 734, 738 (R.I. 1992) ("Because innate physiological differences, boys girls similarly situated enter athletic competition.");Petrie v. Ill. High Sch. Ass'n, 13 394 N.E.2d 855, 861 (Ill. App. Ct. 1979) (noting "high school boys [generally possess physiological advantages over] girl counterparts" advantages give unfair lead girls sports like "high school track"); 16 (9) recent study female male Olympic performances since 1983 found that, although athletes sexes improved time span, "gender gap" female male performances remained stable. "These suggest women's performances high level never match men." Valerie Thibault et al., Women men sport performance: 20 gender gap evolved since 1983, 9 Journal Sports Science Medicine 214, 219 21 (2010); 22 (10) Duke law professor All-American track athlete Doriane Coleman, tennis champion Martina Navratilova, Olympic track gold medalist Sanya Richards-Ross recently wrote: "The evidence unequivocal starting puberty, every sport except sailing, shooting, riding, always significant numbers boys men would beat best girls women head-to-head competition. Claims contrary simply denial science," 27 Doriane Coleman, Martina Navratilova, et al., Pass Equality Act, Abandon Title IX, 28 Washington Post (Apr. 29, 2019); 29 (11) benefits natural testosterone provides male athletes diminished use puberty blockers cross-sex hormones. recent study impact treatments found even "after twelve (12) months hormonal therapy," man identifies woman taking cross-sex hormones "had absolute advantage" female athletes 33 "will still likely performance benefits" women, Tommy Lundberg et al., "Muscle 34 LC001518 - Page 3 strength, size composition following twelve (12) months gender-affirming treatment transgender individuals: retained advantage transwomen," Karolinksa Institutet (Sept. 26, 2 2019); 3 (12) separate sex-specific teams furthers efforts promote sex equality. Sex-4 specific teams accomplish providing opportunities female athletes demonstrate skill, strength, athletic abilities also providing opportunities obtain recognition accolades, college scholarships, numerous long-term benefits flow success athletic endeavors. 8 SECTION 2. Synopsis: Malpractice regarding gender therapeutics. Allows claimant bring medical malpractice claim regarding gender transition treatment within 15 years individual becomes 21 years age. Effective: July 1, 2023. Virginia, 518 U.S. 515, 533 (1996); 4 (2) "inherent differences" range chromosomal hormonal differences physiological differences; 6 (3) Men generally "denser, stronger bones, tendons, ligaments" "larger hearts, greater lung volume per body mass, higher red blood cell count, higher hemoglobin," Neel 8 Burton, Battle Sexes, Psychology Today (July 2, 2012); 9 (4) Men also higher natural levels testosterone, affects traits hemoglobin levels, body fat content, storage use carbohydrates, development type 2 muscle fibers, result men able generate higher speed power physical activity, Doriane Lambelet Coleman, Sex Sport, Law Contemporary 13 Problems 63, 74 (2017) (quoting Gina Kolata, Men, Women Speed. 2 Words: Got 14 Testosterone?, N.Y. Times (Aug. 21, 2008)); 15 (5) biological differences females males, especially relates natural levels testosterone, "explain male female secondary sex characteristics develop puberty lifelong effects, including important success sport: categorically different strength, speed, endurance," Doriane Lambelet Coleman Wickliffe 19 LC001518 - Page 2 5 Shreve, "Comparing Athletic Performances: Best Elite Women Boys Men," Duke Law 1 Center Sports Law Policy; 2 (6) classifications based sex generally disfavored, Supreme Court recognized "sex classifications may used compensate women particular economic disabilities [they have] suffered, promote equal employment opportunity, [and] advance full development talent capacities Nation's people," United States v. Virginia, 518 6 U.S. 515, 533 (1996); 7 (7) One place sex classifications allow "full development talent capacities Nation's people" context sports athletics; 9 (8) Courts recognized inherent, physiological differences males females result different athletic capabilities. See e.g. Kleczek v. Rhode Island Interscholastic 11 League, Inc., 612 A.2d 734, 738 (R.I. 1992) ("Because innate physiological differences, boys girls similarly situated enter athletic competition.");Petrie v. Ill. High Sch. Ass'n, 13 394 N.E.2d 855, 861 (Ill. App. Ct. 1979) (noting "high school boys [generally possess physiological advantages over] girl counterparts" advantages give unfair lead girls sports like "high school track"); 16 (9) recent study female male Olympic performances since 1983 found that, although athletes sexes improved time span, "gender gap" female male performances remained stable. "These suggest women's performances high level never match men." Valerie Thibault et al., Women men sport performance: 20 gender gap evolved since 1983, 9 Journal Sports Science Medicine 214, 219 21 (2010); 22 (10) Duke law professor All-American track athlete Doriane Coleman, tennis champion Martina Navratilova, Olympic track gold medalist Sanya Richards-Ross recently wrote: "The evidence unequivocal starting puberty, every sport except sailing, shooting, riding, always significant numbers boys men would beat best girls women head-to-head competition. Claims contrary simply denial science," 27 Doriane Coleman, Martina Navratilova, et al., Pass Equality Act, Abandon Title IX, 28 Washington Post (Apr. 29, 2019); 29 (11) benefits natural testosterone provides male athletes diminished use puberty blockers cross-sex hormones. recent study impact treatments found even "after twelve (12) months hormonal therapy," man identifies woman taking cross-sex hormones "had absolute advantage" female athletes 33 "will still likely performance benefits" women, Tommy Lundberg et al., "Muscle 34 LC001518 - Page 3 strength, size composition following twelve (12) months gender-affirming treatment transgender individuals: retained advantage transwomen," Karolinksa Institutet (Sept. 26, 2 2019); 3 (12) separate sex-specific teams furthers efforts promote sex equality. Sex-4 specific teams accomplish providing opportunities female athletes demonstrate skill, strength, athletic abilities also providing opportunities obtain recognition accolades, college scholarships, numerous long-term benefits flow success athletic endeavors. 8 SECTION 2. Protection educational institutions. 32 government entity, licensing accrediting organization, athletic association organization shall entertain complaint, open investigation, take adverse 34 LC001518 - Page 4 action school institution higher education maintaining separate interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, club athletic teams sports students female sex. 2 16-112-4. House Concurrent Resolution No. 3010 - Sixty-eighth Legislative Assembly North Dakota - LC Number 23.3027.02000 23.3027.02000 Sixty-eighth Legislative Assembly North Dakota Introduced Representatives S. Olson, K. Anderson, Henderson, Meier, Novak, Rohr, Steiner, VanWinkle concurrent resolution urging public schools public entities, including agencies departments collect vital statistics, protect women's rights distinguishing sexes according biological sex birth purpose providing equal opportunities ensuring privacy safety women girls. WHEREAS, male female possess unique immutable biological differences manifest prior birth increase individual ages experiences puberty; WHEREAS, biological differences sexes mean female able become pregnant, give birth, breastfeed children; WHEREAS, biological differences sexes mean male is, average, bigger, stronger, faster female; WHEREAS, biological differences sexes leave female physically vulnerable male specific forms violence, including sexual violence; WHEREAS, females suffered historically discrimination education, athletics, employment; WHEREAS, comes sex, "equal" mean "same" "identical" separate inherently unequal; WHEREAS, biological differences sexes enduring may warrant creation separate social, educational, athletic, spaces ensure safety allow members sex succeed thrive; WHEREAS, inconsistencies court rulings policy initiatives respect definitions "sex", "male", "female", "man", "woman" led endangerment single-sex spaces resources, thereby necessitating clarification certain terms; WHEREAS, legitimate reasons distinguish sexes respect athletics, prisons detention facilities, domestic violence shelters, rape abuse Page No. 1 23.3027.02000 HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION NO. 3010 Sixty-eighth Legislative Assembly crisis centers, locker rooms, restrooms, areas safety privacy implicated; WHEREAS, policies laws distinguish sexes subject intermediate constitutional scrutiny, forbids unfair discrimination similarly situated males females allows law distinguish sexes distinctions substantially related important governmental objectives; NOW, THEREFORE, RESOLVED HOUSE REPRESENTATIVES NORTH DAKOTA, SENATE CONCURRING THEREIN: Sixty-eighth Legislative Assembly urges public schools public entities, including agencies departments collect vital statistics, protect women's rights distinguishing sexes according biological sex birth purpose providing equal opportunities ensuring privacy safety women girls; RESOLVED, Secretary State forward copy resolution Superintendent Public Instruction, superintendent school district state, Executive Director Department Health Human Services. Section 1-1-201, MCA, amended read: 14 "1-1-201. Terms wide applicability. (1) Unless context requires otherwise, following definitions apply Montana Code Annotated: 16 (a) "Female" means member human species that, normal development, produces relatively large, relatively immobile gamete, egg, life cycle reproductive endocrine system oriented around production gamete. 19 (b) "Male" means member human species that, normal development, produces small, mobile gametes, sperm, life cycle reproductive endocrine system oriented around production gamete. 22 (a)(c) "Oath" includes affirmation declaration. 23 (b)(d) "Person" includes corporation entity well natural person. 24 (c)(e) "Several" means two more. 25 (f) "Sex" means organization body gametes reproduction human beings organisms. human beings, exactly two sexes, male female, two corresponding gametes. sexes determined biological indication male female, including sex chromosomes, 28 **** 68th Legislature 2023 SB 458.1 - 2 - Authorized Print Version – SB 458 gonads, nonambiguous internal external genitalia present birth, without regard individual's psychological, chosen, subjective experience gender. 2 (d)(g) "State", applied different parts United States, includes District 3 Columbia territories. 4 (e)(h) "United States" includes District Columbia territories. 5 (2) Wherever word "man" "men" word includes syllable "man" "men" combination syllables, "workman", appears code, word syllable includes 7 "woman" "women" unless context clearly indicates contrary intent unless subject matter statute relates clearly necessarily specific sex only. 9 (3) Whenever term "heretofore" occurs statute, must construed mean time previous day statute takes effect. Whenever word "hereafter" occurs, must construed mean time statute containing term takes effect." 12 13 Section 2. Section 2-18-208, MCA, amended read: 14 "2-18-208. Virginia, 518 U.S. 515, 533 (1996); 4 (2) "inherent differences" range chromosomal hormonal differences physiological differences; 6 (3) Men generally "denser, stronger bones, tendons, ligaments" "larger hearts, greater lung volume per body mass, higher red blood cell count, higher hemoglobin," Neel 8 Burton, Battle Sexes, Psychology Today (July 2, 2012); 9 (4) Men also higher natural levels testosterone, affects traits hemoglobin levels, body fat content, storage use carbohydrates, development type 2 muscle fibers, result men able generate higher speed power physical activity, Doriane Lambelet Coleman, Sex Sport, Law Contemporary 13 Problems 63, 74 (2017) (quoting Gina Kolata, Men, Women Speed. 2 Words: Got 14 Testosterone?, N.Y. Times (Aug. 21, 2008)); 15 (5) biological differences females males, especially relates natural levels testosterone, "explain male female secondary sex characteristics develop puberty lifelong effects, including important success sport: categorically different strength, speed, endurance," Doriane Lambelet Coleman Wickliffe 19 LC001518 - Page 2 5 Shreve, "Comparing Athletic Performances: Best Elite Women Boys Men," Duke Law 1 Center Sports Law Policy; 2 (6) classifications based sex generally disfavored, Supreme Court recognized "sex classifications may used compensate women particular economic disabilities [they have] suffered, promote equal employment opportunity, [and] advance full development talent capacities Nation's people," United States v. Virginia, 518 6 U.S. 515, 533 (1996); 7 (7) One place sex classifications allow "full development talent capacities Nation's people" context sports athletics; 9 (8) Courts recognized inherent, physiological differences males females result different athletic capabilities. See e.g. Kleczek v. Rhode Island Interscholastic 11 League, Inc., 612 A.2d 734, 738 (R.I. 1992) ("Because innate physiological differences, boys girls similarly situated enter athletic competition.");Petrie v. Ill. High Sch. Ass'n, 13 394 N.E.2d 855, 861 (Ill. App. Ct. 1979) (noting "high school boys [generally possess physiological advantages over] girl counterparts" advantages give unfair lead girls sports like "high school track"); 16 (9) recent study female male Olympic performances since 1983 found that, although athletes sexes improved time span, "gender gap" female male performances remained stable. "These suggest women's performances high level never match men." Valerie Thibault et al., Women men sport performance: 20 gender gap evolved since 1983, 9 Journal Sports Science Medicine 214, 219 21 (2010); 22 (10) Duke law professor All-American track athlete Doriane Coleman, tennis champion Martina Navratilova, Olympic track gold medalist Sanya Richards-Ross recently wrote: "The evidence unequivocal starting puberty, every sport except sailing, shooting, riding, always significant numbers boys men would beat best girls women head-to-head competition. Claims contrary simply denial science," 27 Doriane Coleman, Martina Navratilova, et al., Pass Equality Act, Abandon Title IX, 28 Washington Post (Apr. 29, 2019); 29 (11) benefits natural testosterone provides male athletes diminished use puberty blockers cross-sex hormones. recent study impact treatments found even "after twelve (12) months hormonal therapy," man identifies woman taking cross-sex hormones "had absolute advantage" female athletes 33 "will still likely performance benefits" women, Tommy Lundberg et al., "Muscle 34 LC001518 - Page 3 strength, size composition following twelve (12) months gender-affirming treatment transgender individuals: retained advantage transwomen," Karolinksa Institutet (Sept. 26, 2 2019); 3 (12) separate sex-specific teams furthers efforts promote sex equality. Sex-4 specific teams accomplish providing opportunities female athletes demonstrate skill, strength, athletic abilities also providing opportunities obtain recognition accolades, college scholarships, numerous long-term benefits flow success athletic endeavors. 8 SECTION 2. Title 16 General Laws entitled "EDUCATION" hereby amended adding thereto following chapter: 10 CHAPTER 112 11 FAIRNESS WOMEN'S SPORTS ACT 12 16-112-1. Short title. 13 chapter shall known may cited "Fairness Women's Sports Act". 14 16-112-2. Designation athletic teams. 15 Interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, club athletic teams sports sponsored public school public school district activities association public institution higher education higher education institution member national collegiate athletic association (NCAA), national association intercollegiate athletics (NAIA), national junior college athletic association (NJCAA) shall expressly designated one following based biological sex: 21 (1) Males, men, boys; 22 (2) Females, women, girls; 23 (3) Coed mixed. 24 (i) Athletic teams sports designated females, women, girls shall open students male sex. 26 (ii) disputed, student may establish sex presenting signed physician's statement shall indicate student's sex based solely on: 28 (A) student's internal external reproductive anatomy; 29 (B) student's normal endogenously produced levels testosterone; 30 (C) analysis student's genetic makeup. 31 16-112-3. Protection educational institutions. 32 government entity, licensing accrediting organization, athletic association organization shall entertain complaint, open investigation, take adverse 34 LC001518 - Page 4 action school institution higher education maintaining separate interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, club athletic teams sports students female sex. 2 16-112-4. Cause action. 3 (a) student deprived athletic opportunity suffers direct indirect harm result violation chapter shall private cause action injunctive relief, damages, relief available law school institution higher education. 7 (b) student subject retaliation adverse action school, institution higher education, athletic association organization result reporting violation chapter employee representative school, institution, athletic association organization, state federal agency oversight schools institutions higher education state, shall private cause action injunctive relief, damages, relief available law school, institution, athletic association organization. 14 (c) school institution higher education suffers direct indirect harm result violation chapter shall private cause action injunctive relief, damages, relief available law government entity, licensing accrediting organization, athletic association organization. 18 (d) civil actions shall initiated within two (2) years harm occurred. Persons organizations prevail claim brought pursuant section shall entitled monetary damages, including psychological, emotional, physical harm suffered, reasonable attorneys' fees costs, appropriate relief. 22 16-112-5. Severability. 23 provisions chapter hereby declared severable provision chapter application provision person circumstance declared invalid reason, declaration shall affect validity remaining portions chapter. 27 SECTION 3. act shall take effect January 1, 2024. 28 ======== LC001518 ======== LC001518 - Page 5 5 EXPLANATION LEGISLATIVE COUNCIL N C RELATING EDUCATION -- FAIRNESS WOMEN'S SPORTS ACT *** act would categorize women biological identity birth rather gender identity purpose organized sports. team would categorized males, men, boys; females, women, girls; coed mixed. dispute, student would establish sex presenting signed physician's statement shall indicate student's sex. Additionally, act would create cause action student deprived athletic opportunity subject retaliation result violations chapter. 6 act would take effect January 1, 2024. 7 ======== LC001518 ======== MISSISSIPPI LEGISLATURE 2023 Regular Session To: Public Health Human Services By: Representative Lamar House Bill 1126 ACT RESTRICT TRANSGENDER MEDICAL PROCEDURES PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE; PROVIDE DEFINITIONS ACT; PROHIBIT ADMINISTRATION ASSISTANCE ADMINISTRATION CROSS SEX HORMONES PUBERTY BLOCKING DRUGS; PROHIBIT PERFORMANCE GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY; PROHIBIT PHYSICIANS HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS PROVIDING GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE; PROHIBIT PHYSICIANS HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS REFERRING PERSON CERTAIN AGE HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONAL GENDER TRANSITION GENDER REASSIGNMENT PROCEDURES; PROHIBIT PARENTS, GUARDIANS PERSONS RESPONSIBLE CARE PERSON CERTAIN AGE CONSENTING PROVIDING PUBERTY-BLOCKING DRUGS, CROSS SEX HORMONES; PROVIDE CERTAIN EXCEPTIONS PROHIBITIONS; AMEND SECTION 97-5-39, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, INCLUDE VIOLATIONS ACT PENALTIES CHILD ABUSE; AMEND SECTION 43-21-105, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, REVISE DEFINITION CHILD ABUSE INCLUDE VIOLATION ACT; AMEND SECTION 97-5-51, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, REQUIRE MANDATORY REPORTING PERSONS VIOLATE PROVISIONS ACT; PROHIBIT DIRECT INDIRECT USE, GRANT, PAYMENT DISTRIBUTION PUBLIC FUNDS ENTITY, ORGANIZATION INDIVIDUAL PROVIDES GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE; PROVIDE HEALTH CARE SERVICES FURNISHED STATE LOCALLY-OWNED HEALTH CARE FACILITY PHYSICIAN HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYED STATE LOCAL GOVERNMENT SHALL INCLUDE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE; PROVIDE AMOUNTS PAID TAXABLE YEAR PROVISION GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PREMIUMS HEALTH CARE COVERAGE INCLUDES COVERAGE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES DEDUCTIBLE STATE INCOME TAX LAWS; PROVIDE REFERRAL PROVISION GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE PHYSICIAN HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONAL UNPROFESSIONAL CONDUCT SUBJECT DISCIPLINE APPROPRIATE LICENSING ENTITY HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONAL; AUTHORIZE ATTORNEY GENERAL BRING ACTION ENFORCE COMPLIANCE ACT; CREATE NEW SECTION 43-13-117.7, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT DIVISION MEDICAID REIMBURSING PROVIDING COVERAGE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE; AMEND SECTION 83-9-22, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE HEALTH COVERAGE PLANS REQUIRED INCLUDE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES; CREATE NEW SECTION 83-9-37, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE HEALTH BENEFIT PLAN INSURANCE POLICY PLAN PROVIDING HEALTH CARE COVERAGE SHALL INCLUDE REIMBURSEMENT GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON TWENTY-ONE YEARS AGE; AMEND SECTIONS 27-7-17, 73-15-29 73-25-29, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, CONFORM PROVISIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 11-46-5, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, EXCLUDE TORT IMMUNITY VIOLATIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 11-1-60, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, EXCLUDE VIOLATION ACT LIMITS NONECONOMIC DAMAGES; RELATED PURPOSES. ENACTED LEGISLATURE STATE MISSISSIPPI: SECTION 1. purposes act, following terms shall meanings ascribed herein: (a) "Biological sex" means biological indication male female context reproductive potential capacity, sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, nonambiguous internal external genitalia present birth, without regard individual's psychological, chosen, subjective experience gender; (b) "Cross-sex hormones" means: (i) Testosterone androgens given biological females amounts larger potent would normally occur naturally healthy biological sex females; (ii) Estrogen given biological males amounts larger potent would normally occur naturally healthy biological sex males; (c) "Gender" means psychological, behavioral, social, cultural aspects male female; (d) "Gender reassignment surgery" means medical surgical service seeks surgically alter remove healthy physical anatomical characteristics features typical individual's biological sex, order instill create physiological anatomical characteristics resemble sex different individual's biological sex, including, without limitation, genital nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed purpose assisting individual gender transition including, without limitation: (i) Surgical procedures penectomy, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, vulvoplasty biologically male patients hysterectomy ovariectomy biologically female patients; (ii) Reconstruction fixed part urethra without metoidioplasty; (iii) Phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, implantation erection testicular prostheses biologically female patients; (iv) Surgical procedures biologically male patients, augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, various aesthetic procedures; (v) Surgical procedures biologically female patients, subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, various aesthetic procedures; (e) "Gender transition" means process person goes identifying living gender corresponds biological sex identifying living gender different biological sex, may involve social, legal, physical changes; (f) (i) "Gender transition procedures" means medical surgical service, including, without limitation, physician's services, inpatient outpatient hospital services, prescribed drugs related gender transition seek to: 1. Alter remove physical anatomical characteristics features typical individual's biological sex; 2. Instill create physiological anatomical characteristics resemble sex different individual's biological sex, including, without limitation, medical services provide puberty-blocking drugs, cross-sex hormones, mechanisms promote development feminizing masculinizing features opposite biological sex, genital nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed purpose assisting individual gender transition. (ii) "Gender transition procedures" include: 1. Services persons born medically verifiable disorder sex development, including person external biological sex characteristics irresolvably ambiguous, born forty-six (46) XX chromosomes virilization, forty-six (46) XY chromosomes undervirilization, ovarian testicular tissue; 2. Services provided physician otherwise diagnosed disorder sexual development physician determined genetic biochemical testing person normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, sex steroid hormone action; 3. treatment infection, injury, disease, disorder caused exacerbated performance gender transition procedures, whether gender transition procedure performed accordance state federal law whether funding gender transition procedure permissible act; 4. procedure undertaken individual suffers physical disorder, physical injury, physical illness would, certified physician, place individual imminent danger death impairment major bodily function unless surgery performed; (g) "Health care professional" means person licensed, certified, otherwise authorized laws state administer health care ordinary course practice profession; (h) "Physician" means person licensed practice medicine state; (i) "Puberty-blocking drugs" means gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues synthetic drugs used biological males stop luteinizing hormone secretion therefore testosterone secretion, synthetic drugs used biological females stop production estrogens progesterone, used delay suppress pubertal development children purpose assisting individual gender transition; (j) "Public funds" means state, county, local government monies, addition department, agency, instrumentality authorized appropriated state law derived fund monies deposited. SECTION 2. (1) (a) person may administer, supply, consent to, assist administering supplying puberty-blocking drug cross-sex hormone person age twenty-one (21) years age. (b) person shall perform provide, assist performance provision gender transition procedures gender reassignment surgery person age twenty-one (21) years age. (c) physician health care professional shall provide gender transition procedures person twenty-one (21) years age. (d) physician, health care professional shall refer person twenty-one (21) years age health care professional gender transition procedures. (e) person violates prohibitions described section shall guilty felony crime "gender disfigurement" upon conviction, fined less Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000.00), sentenced five (5) years custody Department Corrections, both. (2) physician violates prohibition subsection (1) section shall license practice medicine State Mississippi revoked pursuant action taken Mississippi State Board Medical Licensure. (3) claim accruing July 1, 2023, private cause action may brought physician, osteopath hospital injuries arising course medical, surgical professional services related performance gender reassignment surgery services. (4) claim accruing July 1, 2023, claim provided subsection (2) section may brought unless filed within five (5) years date alleged act occurred. (5) time cause action arose, person claim accrued shall twenty-one (21) years age younger, minor person claiming minor may, notwithstanding period time limited pursuant subsection (3) section shall expired, commence action claim time within two (2) years next time minor shall reached twenty-first birthday, shall died, whichever shall first occurred. SECTION 4. Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code 1972, amended follows: 43-21-105. following words phrases, purposes chapter, shall meanings ascribed herein unless context clearly otherwise requires: (a) "Youth court" means Youth Court Division. (b) "Judge" means judge Youth Court Division. (c) "Designee" means person judge appoints perform duty chapter requires done judge designee. judge may appoint person involved law enforcement employee Mississippi Department Human Services Mississippi Department Child Protection Services designee. (d) "Child" "youth" synonymous, means person reached eighteenth birthday. child reached eighteenth birthday active duty branch armed services married considered "child" "youth" purposes chapter. (e) "Parent" means father mother child born, father mother child legally adopted. (f) "Guardian" means court-appointed guardian person child. (g) "Custodian" means person present care custody child whether person parent otherwise. (h) "Legal custodian" means court-appointed custodian child. (i) "Delinquent child" means child reached tenth birthday committed delinquent act. (j) "Delinquent act" act, committed adult, designated crime state federal law, municipal county ordinance offenses punishable life imprisonment death. delinquent act includes escape lawful detention violations Uniform Controlled Substances Law violent behavior. (k) "Child need supervision" means child reached seventh birthday need treatment rehabilitation child: (i) habitually disobedient reasonable lawful commands parent, guardian custodian ungovernable; (ii) required attend school, willfully habitually violates rules thereof willfully habitually absents therefrom; (iii) Runs away home without good cause; (iv) committed delinquent act acts. (l) "Neglected child" means child: (i) Whose parent, guardian custodian person responsible care support, neglects refuses, able do, provide proper necessary care support, education required law, medical, surgical, care necessary well-being; however, parent withholds medical treatment child good faith treatment spiritual means alone prayer accordance tenets practices recognized church religious denomination duly accredited practitioner thereof shall not, reason alone, considered neglectful provision chapter; (ii) otherwise without proper care, custody, supervision support; (iii) Who, reason, lacks special care made necessary reason mental condition, whether mental condition mental illness intellectual disability; (iv) Who, reason, lacks care necessary health, morals well-being. (m) "Abused child" means child whose parent, guardian custodian person responsible care support, whether legally obligated not, caused allowed caused, upon child, sexual abuse, sexual exploitation, commercial sexual exploitation, emotional abuse, mental injury, nonaccidental physical injury, administration, supply, consent to, assistance administering supplying puberty-blocking drug cross-sex hormone, gender transition procedures gender reassignment surgery maltreatment. However, physical discipline, including spanking, performed child parent, guardian custodian reasonable manner shall deemed abuse section. "Abused child" also means child trafficked within meaning Mississippi Human Trafficking Act person, without regard relationship person child. (n) "Sexual abuse" means obscene pornographic photographing, filming depiction children commercial purposes, rape, molestation, incest, prostitution forms sexual exploitation children circumstances indicate child's health welfare harmed threatened. (o) "A child need special care" means child mental physical illness cannot treated dispositional alternatives ordinarily available youth court. (p) "dependent child" means child child need supervision, delinquent child, abused child neglected child, child voluntarily placed custody Department Child Protection Services parent, guardian custodian. (q) "Custody" means physical possession child person. (r) "Legal custody" means legal status created court order gives legal custodian responsibilities physical possession child duty provide food, shelter, education reasonable medical care, subject residual rights responsibilities parent guardian person. (s) "Detention" means care children physically restrictive facilities. (t) "Shelter" means care children physically nonrestrictive facilities. (u) "Records involving children" means following child identified: (i) youth court records defined Section 43-21-251; (ii) forensic interviews conducted child advocacy center abuse neglect investigations; (iii) law enforcement records defined Section 43-21-255; (iv) agency records defined Section 43-21-257; (v) documents maintained representative state, county, municipality public agency insofar relate apprehension, custody, adjudication disposition child subject youth court cause. (w) singular includes plural, plural singular masculine feminine consistent intent chapter. (x) "Out-of-home" setting means temporary supervision care children staff licensed day care centers, staff public, private state schools, staff juvenile detention facilities, staff unlicensed residential care facilities group homes staff of, individuals representing, churches, civic social organizations. (y) "Durable legal custody" means legal status created court order gives durable legal custodian responsibilities physical possession child duty provide care, nurture, welfare, food, shelter, education reasonable medical care. duties enumerated subject residual rights responsibilities natural parent(s) guardian(s) child children. (z) "Status offense" means conduct subject adjudication youth court would crime committed adult. (aa) "Financially able" means parent child ineligible court-appointed attorney. (bb) "Assessment" means individualized examination child determine child's psychosocial needs problems, including type extent mental health, substance abuse co-occurring mental health substance abuse disorders recommendations treatment. term includes, limited to, drug alcohol, psychological psychiatric evaluation, records review, clinical interview administration formal test instrument. (cc) "Screening" means process, without administration formal instrument, designed identify child increased risk mental health, substance abuse co-occurring mental health substance abuse disorders warrant immediate attention, intervention comprehensive assessment. (dd) "Durable legal relative guardianship" means legal status created youth court order conveys physical legal custody child children durable legal guardianship relative fictive kin licensed foster resource parent. (ee) "Relative" means person related child affinity consanguinity within third degree. (ff) "Fictive kin" means person related child legally biologically considered relative due significant, familial-like ongoing relationship child family. Section 97-5-51, Mississippi Code 1972, amended follows: 97-5-51. (1) Definitions. purposes section: (a) "Sex crime minor" means offense least one (1) following statutes committed adult minor age sixteen (16): (i) Section 97-3-65 relating rape; (ii) Section 97-3-71 relating rape assault intent ravish; (iii) Section 97-3-95 relating sexual battery; (iv) Section 97-5-23 relating touching child, mentally defective incapacitated person physically helpless person lustful purposes; (v) Section 97-5-41 relating carnal knowledge stepchild, adopted child child cohabiting partner; (vi) Section 97-5-33 relating exploitation children; (vii) Section 97-3-54.1(1)(c) relating procuring sexual servitude minor; (viii) Section 43-47-18 relating sexual abuse vulnerable person; (ix) Section 97-1-7 relating attempt commit offenses listed subsection; (x) Section 97-29-51 relating procuring sexual services minor; * * *and (xi) Section 43-47-18 Section 43-47-19 relating sexual battery abuse vulnerable person minor * * *.; (xii) Subsection (1) Section 3 act. (b) "Mandatory reporter" means following individuals performing occupational duties: health care practitioner, clergy member, teaching child care provider, law enforcement officer, commercial image processor. (c) "Health care practitioner" means individual provides health care services, including physician, surgeon, physical therapist, psychiatrist, psychologist, medical resident, medical intern, hospital staff member, licensed nurse, midwife emergency medical technician paramedic. (d) "Clergy member" means priest, rabbi duly ordained deacon minister. (e) "Teaching child care provider" means anyone provides training supervision minor age sixteen (16), including teacher, teacher's aide, principal staff member public private school, social worker, probation officer, foster home parent, group home child care institutional staff member, personnel residential home facilities, licensed unlicensed day care provider. (f) "Commercial image processor" means person who, compensation: (i) develops exposed photographic film negatives, slides prints; (ii) makes prints negatives slides; (iii) processes stores digital media images digital process, including, limited to, website applications, photography, live streaming video, posting, creation power points means intellectual property communication media including conversion manipulation still shots video digital show stored photography site media storage site. (g) "Caretaker" means person legally obligated provide secure adequate care minor age sixteen (16), including parent, guardian, tutor, legal custodian foster home parent. (6) Penalties. (a) person convicted first offense section shall guilty misdemeanor fined Five Hundred Dollars ($500.00). (b) person convicted second offense section shall guilty misdemeanor fined One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00), imprisoned thirty (30) days, both. (c) person convicted third subsequent offense section shall guilty misdemeanor fined Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00), imprisoned one (1) year, both. Prohibition use public funds tax deduction gender transition procedures. (1) Public funds shall directly indirectly used, granted, paid, distributed entity, organization, individual provides gender transition procedures person twenty-one (21) years age. (2) Health care services furnished following situations shall include gender transition procedures person twenty-one (21) years age: (a) health care facility owned state county local government; (b) physician health care professional employed state county local government. (3) amount paid individual entity taxable year provision gender transition procedures premiums health care coverage includes coverage gender transition procedures deductible state income tax laws. (b) person twenty-one (21) years age may bring action throughout minority parent next friend, may bring action name upon reaching majority time point twenty (20) years reaching age majority. (4) Notwithstanding provision law, action act may commenced, relief may granted, judicial proceeding without regard whether person commencing action sought exhausted available administrative remedies. (5) action proceeding enforce provision act, prevailing party establishes violation act shall recover reasonable attorney's fees. (6) (a) Attorney General may bring action enforce compliance act. (b) act deny, impair, otherwise affect right authority Attorney General, State Mississippi, agency, officer, employee state, acting law act, institute intervene proceeding. SECTION 8. Expenses losses related incurred connection directly indirectly factoring transactions discounting transactions; 3. Royalty, patent, technical copyright fees; 4. Licensing fees; 5. similar expenses costs. (ii) "Intangible property" means patents, patent applications, trade names, trademarks, service marks, copyrights similar types intangible assets. (iii) "Interest expenses cost" means amounts directly indirectly allowed deductions purposes determining taxable income chapter extent interest expenses costs directly indirectly for, related to, connection direct indirect acquisition, maintenance, management, ownership, sale, exchange disposition intangible property. (iv) "Related member" means entity person that, respect taxpayer portion taxable year, related entity, component member defined Internal Revenue Code, entity person attribution stock ownership accordance Section 1563(e) Internal Revenue Code. (v) "Related entity" means: 1. stockholder individual member stockholder's family, defined regulations prescribed commissioner, stockholder members stockholder's family own, directly, indirectly, beneficially constructively, aggregate, least fifty percent (50%) value taxpayer's outstanding stock; 2. stockholder, stockholder's partnership, limited liability company, estate, trust corporation, stockholder stockholder's partnerships, limited liability companies, estates, trusts corporations own, directly, indirectly, beneficially constructively, aggregate, least fifty percent (50%) value taxpayer's outstanding stock; 3. corporation, party related corporation manner would require attribution stock corporation party party corporation, taxpayer owns, directly, indirectly, beneficially constructively, least fifty percent (50%) value corporation's outstanding stock regulation prescribed commissioner; 4. entity person would related member section taxpayer considered corporation purposes section. (d) Nothing subsection shall require taxpayer add net income amount interest expenses costs intangible expenses costs taxpayer pays, accrues incurs related member. MISSISSIPPI LEGISLATURE 2023 Regular Session To: Judiciary, Division By: Senator(s) Hill, DeLano, Tate, Seymour, Whaley, Chism, Younger, Fillingane, Caughman, Moran, McCaughn, Suber, Barrett, Branning, Carter, McLendon, Williams, England, Chassaniol, DeBar, Thompson, Michel, Sojourner, McDaniel, Blackwell Senate Bill 2760 ACT ENACT MISSISSIPPI HELP HARM ACT; CREATE NEW SECTION 11-77-1, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, DEFINE TERMS; CREATE NEW SECTION 11-77-3, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT PERSON KNOWINGLY PERFORMING PROVIDING GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES MINOR; PROHIBIT PERSON KNOWINGLY ENGAGING CONDUCT AIDS ABETS GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES PERFORMED PROVIDED MINOR; PROVIDE LICENSED MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL, INCLUDING, LIMITED TO, PHYSICIAN, OSTEOPATH, PHYSICIAN ASSISTANT, NURSE PRACTITIONER NURSE PERFORMS PROVIDES GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES MINOR SHALL LICENSE REVOKED; PROVIDE PRIVATE CAUSE ACTION PHYSICIAN, OSTEOPATH, HOSPITAL, PRESCRIBING CAREGIVER, CLINIC HEALTH CARE FACILITY INJURIES ARISING COURSE MEDICAL, SURGICAL PROFESSIONAL SERVICES RELATED PERFORMANCE GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES; PROVIDE CLAIM MUST BROUGHT WITHIN 30 YEARS DATE ALLEGED ACT OCCURRED; PROVIDE ATTORNEY GENERAL MAY BRING ACTION ENFORCE COMPLIANCE ACT; PROVIDE CERTAIN EXCEPTIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 73-25-29, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, CONFORM PROVISIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 73-25-33, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, REVISE PHYSICIAN'S SCOPE PRACTICE PROVIDE PRACTICE MEDICINE SHALL MEAN KNOWINGLY PROVIDE GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES MINORS; AMEND SECTION 11-46-5, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, ESTABLISH EMPLOYEE SHALL CONSIDERED ACTING WITHIN COURSE SCOPE EMPLOYMENT GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY MAY LIABLE CONSIDERED WAIVED IMMUNITY CONDUCT EMPLOYEE EMPLOYEE'S CONDUCT VIOLATED PROVISIONS ACT; CREATE NEW SECTION 43-13-117.7, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT DIVISION MEDICAID REIMBURSING ENTITY PART COSTS CARE SERVICES RENDERED GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES; CREATE NEW SECTION 83-9-401, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT HEALTH COVERAGE PLANS FUNDED WHOLLY PART STATE FUNDS STATE-EMPLOYEE CONTRIBUTIONS REIMBURSING AUTHORIZING PAYMENT PART COSTS CARE SERVICES RENDERED ENTITY GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES; AMEND SECTION 11-1-60, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE CAUSE ACTION FILED JULY 1, 2023, CLAIM BROUGHT SECTION 11-77-3, EVENT TRIER FACT FINDS DEFENDANT LIABLE, SHALL LIMITATION PLACED NONECONOMIC DAMAGES AWARD TRIER FACT MAY AWARD PLAINTIFF; RELATED PURPOSES. ENACTED LEGISLATURE STATE MISSISSIPPI: SECTION 1. act shall known may cited "Mississippi Help Harm Act." SECTION 2. following shall codified Section 11-77-1, Mississippi Code 1972: 11-77-1. purposes chapter, following terms shall meanings ascribed herein: (a) "Sex" means biological indication male female context reproductive potential capacity, sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads ambiguous internal external genitalia present birth, without regard individual's psychological, chosen subjective experience gender. (b) "Gender" means psychological, behavioral, social cultural aspects male female. (c) "Gender reassignment surgery services" means following medical surgical services performed individual purpose attempting alter appearance affirm individual's perception gender sex, appearance perception inconsistent individual's sex: (i) Prescribing administering puberty-blocking medication stop delay normal puberty; (ii) Prescribing administering supraphysiologic doses testosterone androgens females; (iii) Prescribing administering supraphysiologic doses estrogen males; (iv) Performing surgeries sterilize, including castration, vasectomy, hysterectomy, oophorectomy, orchiectomy penectomy; (v) Performing surgeries artificially construct tissue appearance genitalia differs individual's sex, including metoidioplasty, phalloplasty vaginoplasty; (vi) Removing healthy nondiseased body part tissue, except male circumcision. (5) claim accruing July 1, 2023, claim provided subsection (4) section may brought unless filed within thirty (30) years date alleged act occurred. (6) Attorney General may bring action enforce compliance section. Nothing section shall construed deny, impair otherwise affect right authority Attorney General, state, agency, officer employee state institute intervene proceeding. (7) section shall apply to: (a) Services provided individuals born medically verifiable disorder sex development, including person external sex characteristics irresolvably ambiguous, individual born 46, XX chromosomes virilization, 46, XY chromosomes undervirilization, ovarian testicular tissue; (b) Services provided individual physician otherwise diagnosed disorder sexual development, physician determined genetic biochemical testing individual normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production sex steroid hormone action biological male biological female; (c) treatment infection, injury, disease disorder caused exacerbated performance gender transition procedures, whether procedures performed accordance state federal law; (d) procedure undertaken individual suffers physical disorder, physical injury physical illness certified physician would place individual imminent danger death impairment major bodily function unless surgery performed. (1) purposes section, following terms shall meanings ascribed herein: (a) "Sex" means biological indication male female context reproductive potential capacity, sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads nonambiguous internal external genitalia present birth, without regard individual's psychological, chosen subjective experience gender. (c) "Gender reassignment surgery services" means following medical surgical services performed individual purpose attempting alter appearance affirm individual's perception gender sex, appearance perception inconsistent individual's sex: (i) Prescribing administering puberty-blocking medication stop delay normal puberty; (ii) Prescribing administering supraphysiologic doses testosterone androgens females; (iii) Prescribing administering supraphysiologic doses estrogen males; (iv) Performing surgeries sterilize, including castration, vasectomy, hysterectomy, oophorectomy, orchiectomy penectomy; (v) Performing surgeries artificially construct tissue appearance genitalia differs individual's sex, including metoidioplasty, phalloplasty vaginoplasty; (vi) Removing healthy nondiseased body part tissue, except male circumcision. (d) "Health coverage plan" shall mean health medical expense insurance policy, hospital medical service contract, employee welfare benefit plan, contract agreement health maintenance organization preferred provider organization, health accident insurance policy, including group insurance plan State Health Plan. (2) health coverage plan funded wholly part state funds state-employee contributions shall reimburse authorize payment part costs care services rendered entity gender reassignment surgery services. ENACTED LEGISLATURE STATE TEXAS: SECTION 1. Chapter 161, Health Safety Code, amended adding Subchapter X read follows: SUBCHAPTER X. GENDER TRANSITIONING GENDER REASSIGNMENT PROCEDURES TREATMENTS CERTAIN CHILDREN Sec. 161.701. DEFINITIONS. subchapter: (1) "Child" means individual younger years age. (2) "Health care provider" means person physician licensed, certified, otherwise authorized state's laws provide render health care dispense prescribe prescription drug ordinary course business practice profession. (3) "Physician" means person licensed practice medicine state. Sec. 161.702. PROHIBITED PROVISION GENDER TRANSITIONING GENDER REASSIGNMENT PROCEDURES TREATMENTS CERTAIN CHILDREN. purpose transitioning child's biological sex determined sex organs, chromosomes, endogenous profiles child affirming child's perception child's sex perception inconsistent child's biological sex, physician health care provider may not: (1) perform surgery sterilizes child, including: (A) castration; (B) vasectomy; (C) hysterectomy; (D) oophorectomy; (E) metoidioplasty; (F) orchiectomy; (G) penectomy; (H) phalloplasty; (I) vaginoplasty; (2) perform mastectomy; (3) provide, administer, prescribe, dispense following prescription drugs induce transient permanent infertility: (A) puberty suppression blocking prescription drugs stop delay normal puberty; (B) supraphysiologic doses testosterone females; (C) supraphysiologic doses estrogen males; (4) remove otherwise healthy non-diseased body part tissue. Sec. 161.703. EXCEPTIONS. Section 161.702 apply provision physician health care provider, consent child's parent legal guardian, appropriate medically necessary gender transitioning gender reassignment procedures treatments child who: (1) born medically verifiable genetic disorder sex development, including: (A) 46,XX chromosomes virilization; (B) 46,XY chromosomes undervirilization; (C) ovarian testicular tissue; (2) normal sex chromosome structure male female determined physician genetic testing. SENATE, No. 2648 STATE NEW JERSEY 220th LEGISLATURE INTRODUCED MAY 16, 2022 Sponsored by: Senator EDWARD DURR District 3 (Cumberland, Gloucester Salem) SYNOPSIS Prohibits school districts incorporating instruction sexual orientation gender identity students grades kindergarten six; requires consent parents guardians students grades seven 12 instruction sexual orientation gender identity. CURRENT VERSION TEXT introduced. Act concerning public school curriculum supplementing chapter 35 Title 18A New Jersey Statutes. Enacted Senate General Assembly State New Jersey: 1. a. school district shall include, part course instruction, information sexual orientation gender identity students grades kindergarten six part school district's implementation New Jersey Student Learning Standards. b. school district shall provide instruction students grades seven 12 includes information sexual orientation gender identity without receiving prior written consent student's parent guardian. student whose parent guardian provide prior written consent shall excused portion course instruction provided penalties credit graduation shall result therefrom. 2. a. parent guardian whose child participated course instruction includes information sexual orientation gender identity violation section 1 act may bring civil action court competent jurisdiction injunctive relief. b. school district employee school district knowingly violates provisions section 1 act, Office Attorney General may seek injunction school district employee school district. 3. Commissioner Education may withhold State funds school district knowingly violates provisions section 1 act commissioner finds school district longer violation section. 4. act shall take effect immediately shall first apply first full school year following date enactment. STATEMENT bill prohibits school districts incorporating instruction sexual orientation gender identity students grades kindergarten six. bill, student grades seven 12 whose parent guardian provide prior written consent participate course includes information sexual orientation gender identity excused portion course without penalty. Also bill, parent guardian whose child participated course includes information sexual orientation gender identity grades kindergarten six, grades seven 12 without prior written consent, may bring civil action court competent jurisdiction injunctive relief. school district employee school district knowingly violates provisions section, Office Attorney General may seek injunction school district employee school district. MISSISSIPPI LEGISLATURE 2023 Regular Session To: Public Health Human Services By: Representatives Newman, Gunn, Eubanks, Tullos, Brown (20th), Williamson, Hopkins House Bill 1125 ACT CREATE "REGULATE EXPERIMENTAL ADOLESCENT PROCEDURES (REAP)" ACT PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS AGE; PROVIDE DEFINITIONS ACT; PROHIBIT DIRECT INDIRECT USE, GRANT, PAYMENT DISTRIBUTION PUBLIC FUNDS ENTITY, ORGANIZATION INDIVIDUAL PROVIDES GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS AGE; PROVIDE HEALTH CARE SERVICES FURNISHED STATE LOCALLY-OWNED HEALTH CARE FACILITY PHYSICIAN HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONAL EMPLOYED STATE LOCAL GOVERNMENT SHALL INCLUDE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS AGE; PROVIDE AMOUNTS PAID TAXABLE YEAR PROVISION GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PREMIUMS HEALTH CARE COVERAGE INCLUDES COVERAGE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES DEDUCTIBLE STATE INCOME TAX LAWS; AUTHORIZE ATTORNEY GENERAL BRING ACTION ENFORCE COMPLIANCE ACT; CREATE NEW SECTION 43-13-117.7, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT DIVISION MEDICAID REIMBURSING PROVIDING COVERAGE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS AGE; AMEND SECTION 83-9-22, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE HEALTH COVERAGE PLANS REQUIRED INCLUDE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES; CREATE NEW SECTION 83-9-37, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE HEALTH BENEFIT PLAN INSURANCE POLICY PLAN PROVIDING HEALTH CARE COVERAGE SHALL INCLUDE REIMBURSEMENT GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES PERSON EIGHTEEN YEARS AGE; AMEND SECTIONS 27-7-17, 73-15-29 73-25-29, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, CONFORM PROVISIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 73-25-33, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, EXCLUDE PERFORMANCE GENDER TRANSITION PROCEDURES "PRACTICE MEDICINE" MEANING; AMEND SECTION 11-46-5, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, EXCLUDE TORT IMMUNITY VIOLATIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 41-41-219, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, CONFORM PRECEDING SECTION; PROVIDE SEVERABILITY PART ACT FOUND UNCONSTITUTIONAL; RELATED PURPOSES. ENACTED LEGISLATURE STATE MISSISSIPPI: SECTION 1. act shall known may cited "Regulate Experimental Adolescent Procedures (REAP) Act. SECTION 2. purposes act, following terms shall meanings ascribed herein: (a) "Sex" means biological indication male female context reproductive potential capacity, sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads, nonambiguous internal external genitalia present birth, without regard individual's psychological, chosen, subjective experience gender; (b) "Cross-sex hormones" means: (i) Testosterone androgens given females amounts larger potent would normally occur naturally healthy sex females; (ii) Estrogen given males amounts larger potent would normally occur naturally healthy sex males; (c) "Gender" means psychological, behavioral, social, cultural aspects male female; (d) "Gender reassignment surgery" means medical surgical service seeks surgically alter remove healthy physical anatomical characteristics features, except male circumcision typical individual's sex, order instill create physiological anatomical characteristics resemble sex different individual's sex, including, without limitation: (i) Surgical procedures penectomy, castration, orchiectomy, vaginoplasty, clitoroplasty, vulvoplasty male patients; (ii) Surgical procedures hysterectomy, oophorectomy, reconstruction urethra, metoidioplasty, phalloplasty, vaginectomy, scrotoplasty, implantation erection testicular prostheses female patients; (iii) Surgical procedures augmentation mammoplasty, facial feminization surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, voice surgery, thyroid cartilage reduction, gluteal augmentation, hair reconstruction, various aesthetic procedures male patients; (iv) Surgical procedures subcutaneous mastectomy, voice surgery, liposuction, lipofilling, pectoral implants, various aesthetic procedures female patients; (e) "Gender transition" means process person goes identifying living gender corresponds sex identifying living gender different sex, may involve social, legal, physical changes; (f) (i) "Gender transition procedures" means following medical surgical services performed purpose assisting individual gender transition: 1. Prescribing administering puberty-blocking drugs; 2. Prescribing administering cross-sex hormones; 3. Performing gender reassignment surgeries. (ii) "Gender transition procedures" include: 1. Services persons born medically verifiable disorder sex development, including person external sex characteristics irresolvably ambiguous, born forty-six (46) XX chromosomes virilization, forty-six (46) XY chromosomes undervirilization, ovarian testicular tissue; 2. Services provided physician otherwise diagnosed disorder sexual development physician determined genetic biochemical testing person normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, sex steroid hormone action; 3. treatment infection, injury, disease, disorder caused exacerbated performance gender transition procedures, whether gender transition procedure performed accordance state federal law whether funding gender transition procedure permissible act; 4. procedure male circumcision; (g) "Health care professional" means person licensed, certified, otherwise authorized laws state administer health care ordinary course practice profession; (h) "Physician" means person licensed practice medicine state provided Sections 73-25-1 etc.; (i) "Puberty-blocking drugs" means gonadotropin-releasing hormone analogues synthetic drugs used males stop luteinizing hormone secretion therefore testosterone secretion, synthetic drugs used females stop production estrogens progesterone, used delay suppress pubertal development children purpose assisting individual gender transition; (j) "Public funds" means federal, state, county, local government monies, addition department, agency, instrumentality authorized appropriated state law derived fund monies deposited. SECTION 3. (1) person shall knowingly provide gender transition procedures person eighteen (18) years age. (2) person shall knowingly engage conduct aids abets performance inducement gender transition procedures person eighteen (18) years age. subsection may construed impose liability speech protected federal state law. SECTION 4. Prohibition use public funds tax deduction gender transition procedures. (1) Public funds, resources, facilities, personnel thing value provided United States State Mississippi shall directly indirectly used, granted, paid, distributed entity, organization, individual provides gender transition procedures person eighteen (18) years age violation act. (2) Health care services furnished following situations shall include gender transition procedures person eighteen (18) years age: (a) health care facility owned state county local government; (b) physician health care professional employed state county local government. (3) amount paid individual entity taxable year provision gender transition procedures premiums health care coverage includes coverage gender transition procedures deductible state income tax laws. SECTION 5. Enforcement. (1) violation Section 3 physician health care professional shall considered outside applicable standard care unprofessional conduct. physician violates Section 3 shall license practice medicine State Mississippi revoked pursuant action taken Mississippi State Board Medical Licensure. nonphysician healthcare professional violates Section 3 shall license practice healthcare profession State Mississippi revoked pursuant action taken applicable licensing entity. (2) person may assert actual threatened violation act claim defense judicial administrative proceeding obtain compensatory damages, punitive damages, injunctive relief, declaratory relief, appropriate relief. claim may brought facility, individual entity causing contributing violation act. (3) (a) person must bring claim violation act later thirty (30) years day cause action accrues. (b) person eighteen (18) years age may bring action throughout minority parent next friend, may bring action name upon reaching majority time point thirty (30) years reaching age majority. (4) Notwithstanding provision law, action act may commenced, relief may granted, judicial proceeding without regard whether person commencing action sought exhausted available administrative remedies. (5) action proceeding enforce provision act, prevailing party establishes violation act shall recover reasonable attorney's fees. (6) (a) Attorney General shall bring action enforce compliance act. (b) act deny, impair, otherwise affect right authority Attorney General, State Mississippi, agency, officer, employee state, acting law act, institute intervene proceeding. SECTION 6. (iii) "Interest expenses cost" means amounts directly indirectly allowed deductions purposes determining taxable income chapter extent interest expenses costs directly indirectly for, related to, connection direct indirect acquisition, maintenance, management, ownership, sale, exchange disposition intangible property. (v) "Related entity" means: 1. stockholder individual member stockholder's family, defined regulations prescribed commissioner, stockholder members stockholder's family own, directly, indirectly, beneficially constructively, aggregate, least fifty percent (50%) value taxpayer's outstanding stock; 2. stockholder, stockholder's partnership, limited liability company, estate, trust corporation, stockholder stockholder's partnerships, limited liability companies, estates, trusts corporations own, directly, indirectly, beneficially constructively, aggregate, least fifty percent (50%) value taxpayer's outstanding stock; 3. corporation, party related corporation manner would require attribution stock corporation party party corporation, taxpayer owns, directly, indirectly, beneficially constructively, least fifty percent (50%) value corporation's outstanding stock regulation prescribed commissioner; 4. entity person would related member section taxpayer considered corporation purposes section. (b) computing net income, taxpayer shall add back otherwise deductible interest expenses costs intangible expenses costs directly indirectly paid, accrued incurred, connection directly indirectly one direct indirect transactions one related members. (c) adjustments required subsection shall apply portion interest expenses costs intangible expenses costs taxpayer establish meets one (1) following: (i) related member directly indirectly paid, accrued incurred portion person income year related member; (ii) transaction giving rise interest expenses costs intangible expenses costs taxpayer related member done primarily valid business purpose avoidance taxes, related member primarily engaged acquisition, use, maintenance management, ownership, sale, exchange disposition intangible property. (d) Nothing subsection shall require taxpayer add net income amount interest expenses costs intangible expenses costs taxpayer pays, accrues incurs related member. (e) commissioner may prescribe regulations necessary appropriate carry purposes subsection, including, limited to, clarifying definitions terms, rules stock attribution, factoring discount transactions. (3) Individual nonbusiness deductions. MISSISSIPPI LEGISLATURE 2023 Regular Session To: Public Health Human Services By: Representative Ford (73rd) House Bill 1124 ACT KNOWN MISSISSIPPI HELP HARM ACT; CREATE NEW SECTION 11-77-1, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, DEFINE TERMS; CREATE NEW SECTION 11-77-3, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT PERSON KNOWINGLY PERFORMING PROVIDING GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES MINOR; PROVIDE LICENSED MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL PERFORMS PROVIDES GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES MINOR SHALL LICENSE REVOKED; PROVIDE PRIVATE CAUSE ACTION PHYSICIAN, OSTEOPATH, HOSPITAL, PRESCRIBING CAREGIVER, CLINIC HEALTH CARE FACILITY INJURIES ARISING COURSE MEDICAL, SURGICAL PROFESSIONAL SERVICES RELATED PERFORMANCE GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES; PROVIDE CLAIM MUST BROUGHT WITHIN THIRTY YEARS DATE ALLEGED ACT OCCURRED; AUTHORIZE ATTORNEY GENERAL BRING ACTION ENFORCE COMPLIANCE SECTION; PROVIDE SECTION APPLY CERTAIN SERVICES, TREATMENTS PROCEDURES; AMEND SECTION 73-25-29, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, CONFORM PROVISIONS ACT; AMEND SECTION 73-25-33, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, REVISE DEFINITION PRACTICE MEDICINE EXCLUDE GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES MINORS; AMEND SECTION 11-46-5, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE TORT CLAIMS ACT EMPLOYEE SHALL CONSIDERED ACTING WITHIN COURSE SCOPE EMPLOYMENT GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY MAY LIABLE CONSIDERED WAIVED IMMUNITY CONDUCT EMPLOYEE EMPLOYEE'S CONDUCT VIOLATED PROVISIONS ACT; CREATE NEW SECTION 43-13-117.7, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT DIVISION MEDICAID REIMBURSING ENTITY PART COSTS CARE SERVICES RENDERED GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES; CREATE NEW SECTION 83-9-401, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROHIBIT HEALTH COVERAGE PLANS FUNDED WHOLLY PART STATE FUNDS STATE-EMPLOYEE CONTRIBUTIONS REIMBURSING AUTHORIZING PAYMENT PART COSTS CARE SERVICES RENDERED ENTITY GENDER REASSIGNMENT SURGERY SERVICES; AMEND SECTION 11-1-60, MISSISSIPPI CODE 1972, PROVIDE CAUSE ACTION FILED JULY 1, 2023, CLAIM BROUGHT SECTION 11-77-3, TRIER FACT FINDS DEFENDANT LIABLE, SHALL LIMITATION PLACED NONECONOMIC DAMAGES AWARD TRIER FACT MAY AWARD PLAINTIFF; RELATED PURPOSES. ENACTED LEGISLATURE STATE MISSISSIPPI: SECTION 1. act shall known may cited "Mississippi Help Harm Act." SECTION 2. following shall codified Section 11-77-1, Mississippi Code 1972: 11-77-1. purposes chapter, following terms shall meanings defined section: (a) "Gender" means psychological, behavioral, social cultural aspects male female. (b) "Gender reassignment surgery services" means following medical surgical services performed individual purpose attempting alter appearance affirm individual's perception gender sex, appearance perception inconsistent individual's sex: (i) Prescribing administering puberty blocking medication stop delay normal puberty; (ii) Prescribing administering supraphysiologic doses testosterone androgens females; (iii) Prescribing administering supraphysiologic doses estrogen males; (iv) Performing surgeries sterilize, including castration, vasectomy, hysterectomy, oophorectomy, orchiectomy, penectomy; (v) Performing surgeries artificially construct tissue appearance genitalia differs individual's sex, including metoidioplasty, phalloplasty, vaginoplasty; (vi) Removing healthy non-diseased body part tissue, except male circumcision. (c) "Sex" means biological indication male female context reproductive potential capacity, sex chromosomes, naturally occurring sex hormones, gonads nonambiguous internal external genitalia present birth, without regard individual's psychological, chosen subjective experience gender. SECTION 3. following shall codified Section 11-77-3, Mississippi Code 1972: 11-77-3. (1) person shall knowingly perform provide gender reassignment surgery services minor. (2) person shall knowingly engage conduct aids abets gender reassignment surgery services performed provided minor. section may construed impose liability speech conduct protected federal state law. (3) licensed medical professional, including, limited to, physician, osteopath, physician assistant, nurse practitioner nurse, violates prohibition subsection (1) (2) section shall license State Mississippi revoked pursuant action taken respective licensing board. (4) claim accruing July 1, 2023, private cause action may brought physician, osteopath, hospital, prescribing caregiver, clinic health care facility injuries arising course medical, surgical professional services related performance gender reassignment surgery services. (5) claim accruing July 1, 2023, claim provided subsection (4) section may brought unless filed within thirty (30) years date alleged act occurred. (6) Attorney General may bring action enforce compliance section. Nothing section shall construed deny, impair, otherwise affect right authority Attorney General, state, agency, officer, employee state institute intervene proceeding. (7) section shall apply to: (a) Services provided individuals born medically verifiable disorder sex development, including person external sex characteristics irresolvably ambiguous, individual born forty-six XX chromosomes virilization, forty-six XY chromosomes undervirilization, ovarian testicular tissue; (b) Services provided individual physician otherwise diagnosed disorder sexual development, physician determined genetic biochemical testing individual normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, sex steroid hormone action biological male biological female; (c) treatment infection, injury, disease disorder caused exacerbated performance gender transition procedures, whether procedures performed accordance state federal law; (d) procedure undertaken individual suffers physical disorder, physical injury, physical illness certified physician would place individual imminent danger death impairment major bodily function unless surgery performed. (a) department shall designate separate sex-specific athletic teams sports within interscholastic, intercollegiate, intramural, club athletic teams sports. include sports teams sponsored public, primary secondary school, public postsecondary institution, school institution whose students teams compete public school public postsecondary institution. teams shall expressly designated one following based biological sex: (1) Males, men, boys; (2) Females, women, girls; (3) Coed mixed. (2) Therefore, intent Mississippi Legislature, act regulations policies promulgated it, protect minors gender reassignment surgery. SECTION 2. purpose act, following terms shall meaning ascribed herein unless context clearly indicates otherwise: (a) "Gender reassignment surgery" means medical surgical service seeks surgically alter remove healthy physical anatomical characteristics features typical individual's biological sex order instill create physiological anatomical characteristics resemble sex different individual's biological sex, including without limitation, genital nongenital gender reassignment surgery performed purpose assisting individual gender transition. "Gender reassignment surgery" may include, limited to, following procedures: (i) mastectomy; (ii) surgery sterilizes, including: 1. castration; 2. vasectomy; 3. hysterectomy; 4. oophorectomy; 5. metoidioplasty; 6. orchiectomy; 7. penectomy; 8. phalloplasty; 9. vaginoplasty. (b) "Gender transition" means process person goes identifying living gender corresponds biological sex identifying living gender different biological sex, may involve social, legal physical changes. (c) "Medical professional" means physician, surgeon, physician assistant, nurse, clinical nurse specialist, nurse practitioner, anesthetist, psychiatrist medical assistant licensed Mississippi law. (d) "Minor" means child age twenty-one (21). (e) "Sex" means biological state female male, based sex organs, chromosomes endogenous hormone profiles. SECTION 3. (1) person guilty performing gender reassignment surgery upon minor purposely, knowingly recklessly performs, attempts perform, causes performed gender reassignment surgery upon minor purpose assisting minor gender transition. (2) medical professional shall also subject civil fine Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000.00) per occurrence. (3) hearing civil fine required section shall contingent criminal arrest medical professional initiation criminal proceedings medical professional. SECTION 5. Section 63-23-50.(A) Except otherwise provided law court order, person, corporation, association, organization, state supported institution, state agency, political subdivision State, individual employed entities must obtain consent parent child taking following actions: (1) procuring, soliciting perform, arranging performance of, providing referral for, performing surgical procedures upon child; (2) procuring, soliciting perform, arranging performance of, providing referral for, performing physical examination upon child; (3) prescribing dispensing medication prescription drugs child; (4) administering vaccination, immunization, biologic child; (5) procuring, soliciting perform, arranging performance of, providing referral for, performing mental health evaluation clinical nonclinical setting mental health treatment child. (B) parental consent pursuant subsection (A) given telemedicine, person entity obtaining parental consent must verify identity parent site consent given. (C) provisions section shall apply determined physician that: (1) emergency exists; (2) either following conditions true: (a) necessary perform activity listed subsection (A) order prevent death imminent, irreparable physical injury child; (b) parent child cannot located contacted reasonably diligent effort. (D) provisions section apply abortion, shall governed Chapter 41, Title 44. Section 63-23-60.(A) parent may bring suit violation chapter may raise chapter defense judicial administrative proceeding without regard whether proceeding brought name state government, private person, party. (B) Notwithstanding provision law, action chapter may commenced, relief may granted, without regard whether person commencing action sought exhausted available administrative remedies. (C) person successfully asserts claim defense chapter may recover declaratory relief, injunctive relief, compensatory damages, reasonable attorneys' fees costs, appropriate relief; provided, however, compensatory damages available private person acting official capacity representative state government. (D) Sovereign, governmental, qualified immunities suit liability waived abolished extent liability created chapter. Section 63-23-70.(A) Unless rights legally waived legally terminated, parents inalienable rights comprehensive listed section. protections fundamental right parents direct upbringing, education, health care, mental health child afforded chapter addition protections provided federal law, state law, state federal constitutions. (B) chapter shall construed favor broad protection fundamental right parents direct upbringing, education, health care, mental health child. (C) Nothing chapter shall construed authorize government burden fundamental right parents direct upbringing, education, health care, mental health child. (D) child affirmative right access particular medical treatment, nothing chapter shall construed grant child's parent affirmative right access treatment child's behalf.
