No. 3 CONCURRENT RESOLUTION WHEREAS, American Academy Pediatrics, American Medical Association, Children's Hospital Association wrote letter United States Attorney General October 3, 2022, requesting Department Justice investigation organizations, individuals, entities advocate term "gender-affirming health care"; WHEREAS, "Gender-affirming care" unconscionable misnomer abhorrent practice genital mutilation administration puberty blockers children even legally smoke cigarettes; "care" leads irreparable harm, psychological damage, lifetime trauma; WHEREAS, defenders "gender-affirming" treatment wish silence voices undergone gender transitions left immense, debilitating regret; ignore countries examined issue whether minors adequately understand properly consent "gender-affirming care"; landmark 2020 High Court decision United Kingdom, court ruled capacity legally consent taking puberty blockers "highly unlikely" 13-year-olds "doubtful" 14- 15-year-olds; consequently, use puberty blockers suspended children age 16; WHEREAS, July 2022, U.S. Food Drug Administration issued warning regarding gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonists, commonly known puberty blockers; FDA identified plausible association GnRH agonist use pseudotumor cerebri, also known idiopathic intracranial hypertension, occurs pressure inside skull spontaneously increases; condition cause brain swelling, severe headaches, nausea, double vision, even permanent vision loss, according Mayo Clinic; WHEREAS, "Gender-affirming care" dangerous practice destroys lives, would suppress opposition treatment deserving harshest censure; now, therefore, RESOLVED, 88th Legislature State Texas hereby express support ending "gender-affirming care" condemn American Academy Pediatrics, American Medical Association, Children's Hospital Association attempt suppress objections treatment. 88R1595 EAS-D By: Hall, Campbell, Perry S.B. No. 249 BILL ENTITLED ACT relating offense genital mutilation. ENACTED LEGISLATURE STATE TEXAS: SECTION 1. heading Chapter 167, Health Safety Code, amended read follows: CHAPTER 167. [FEMALE] GENITAL MUTILATION SECTION 2. heading Section 167.001, Health Safety Code, amended read follows: Sec. 167.001. [FEMALE] GENITAL MUTILATION PROHIBITED. SECTION 3. Section 167.001, Health Safety Code, amended amending Subsections (a), (c), (d) adding Subsections (a-1), (e), (f) read follows: (a) person commits offense person: (1) knowingly performs procedure described Subsection (a-1) [circumcises, excises, infibulates part labia majora labia minora clitoris of] another person younger 18 years age; (2) parent, caretaker, legal guardian another person younger 18 years age knowingly consents facilitates procedure described Subsection (a-1) [permits act described Subdivision (1)] performed person; (3) knowingly transports facilitates transportation another person younger 18 years age within state state purpose procedure described Subsection (a-1) [an act described Subdivision (1)] performed person. (a-1) section applies procedure involves partial total removal of, injury to, genitals person, including following genital surgeries: (1) clitorectomy, clitoroplasty, clitoral reduction, clitoral recession, including corporal-sparing procedures; (2) vaginoplasty, introitoplasty, vaginal exteriorization, partial total urogenital sinus mobilization; (3) labiaplasty labial reduction; (4) hypospadias surgery, relocation urethral meatus, chordee release; (5) phalloplasty; (6) gonadectomy, including testes, ovaries, ovotestes, streak gonads. (c) defense prosecution Subsection (a) that: (1) person performing procedure [act] physician licensed health care professional procedure [act] within scope person's license; (2) procedure is: (A) necessary person's physical health; (B) male circumcision; (C) performed intersex person [act performed medical purposes]. (d) defense prosecution Subsection (a) [this section] procedure required matter religion, custom, tradition, ritual, standard practice[: [(1) person circumcision, excision, infibulation performed performed, another person authorized consent medical treatment person, including person's parent legal guardian, consented circumcision, excision, infibulation; [(2) circumcision, excision, infibulation required custom practice particular group; [(3) circumcision, excision, infibulation performed performed part connection religious ritual]. (e) section, "intersex person" means person who: (1) inborn chromosomal, gonadal, genital, endocrine characteristics, combination characteristics, suited typical definition male female atypical determined sex person; (2) considered medical professional inborn chromosomal, gonadal, genital, endocrine characteristics ambiguous atypical determined sex person. (f) Title 4, Penal Code, applies offense section.
